climbs.name: Won't Someone Please Think of the Children?!

content.description: A great route for kids and adults alike, this route goes up the obvious weakness in the middle of the wall.  Many many good holds lead to some less favorable but still decent holds.  Once you are fully on the slab section, it's smooth sailing.
content.location: In the middle of the wall.  It's the easiest looking climb out of the water.

content.description: Use good holds and a high foot to grab the small outcropping above you, then traverse right a bit (crux move) before an easy top out.  Look out for grass spiders!
content.location: In the little alcove on the right side of the north wall.  The start is on the best holds in the entire alcove.

content.description: Climb up the arete starting on a nice jug, then carefully navigate the slab to the top.  The topout is a mental crux.
content.location: On the right end of the wall

content.description: A good warmup boulder for the area, start on a shelf just under the surface of the water.  Move straight up on good holds, reaching a bit left as needed, to a top-out crux.  Celebrate your ascent by jumping back in the water from the top!  ...just be sure to jump  to your left where it's a bit deeper.
The rock face on the north side of the river.  Has the easiest problems and also what looks like the hardest project.
